result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ismael Nickos Santiago

defendant.name: Santiago, Ismael Nickos
defendant.address: 344 East Groveland Drive, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: Br. 41 is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case spun to Reserve Branch, Judge Franke.

Defendant Ismael Nickos Santiago in court.  Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court for Ismael Nickos Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  Filed, signed Domestic Violence Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  
The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended for a period of twelve months. State requests review hearing date in Br. 41. Next court hearing held in person.
Review hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions - Stalking
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ismael Nickos Santiago in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ismael Nickos Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-12-22
Received and Filed. Motion to Modify Conditions of Bond

Defendant Ismael Nickos Santiago in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 5 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BLS and KMJ.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 062471,
Payable Number: 1018265,
Receipt Number: 22RP027460,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Ismael Nickos Santiago in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
